wikipedia_page.main: Graham Dee (born Graham Davidson, 2 March 1943) is an English musician.

response: Castle was the younger of two sons of a minister and a schoolteacher. His schoolteacher Mom played piano, and began teaching Castle the piano at an early age. He moved to Hollywood, California in his early 20s, and became a staff writer for United Artists Music Publishing. His first credit was songwriter of "Ten to Eight" from Helen Reddy's 1975 album, No Way to Treat a Lady, which was also used as the B-side to her "Somewhere in the Night" 7-inch single. His first A-side was "If You Feel the Way I Do" (co-written with Graham Dee), the lead track on the Lettermen's 1975 album, The Time Is Right.
